content.title: All forms complete - finishing the PDF and files cut before sending STL!
content.creator:
Inzeth
March 9, 2025
content.content:
Hey everyone,

Just wanted to write a quick note to keep you update as I know many of you are waiting this STL ! (and i'm not going anywhere ;) )
Everyone who asked a STL answered the Form so I now have all the data.
For now the BambuLab 256^3 is ready (it was before the campaign but did a few adjustment) and I'm writing down the PDF documentation, which will contain
assembly process
rivets specs
window mold/template
print optimization
glue/mastic possibilities
screws and clamps mounting
So with this guide you should have everything I learnt from the past 2 years and make the decision based on your time/knowledge.
I must precise that I'm not a professional car-painter and I know more theory than practice, so you should all consider by yourself what's the best to do. Those are just my feedback about what worked well and what didn't.
Also, I must precise that you wont find any print settings as this highly depends on your environment, workshop, season of the year, printer, filament... There are so many parameters I prefer to give you none rather than leading you in errors.
Do some test prints with small parts until you are happy with the result !
The Dash Hoods requried some modification as it was not "that" great (I'm a perfectionist). But to avoid longer wait I will send over the current version and send you an update once it's done :) 

Thank you all. I keep you updated.

content.title: Campaign is over, thanks for your trust! Here are the next steps.
content.creator:
Inzeth
March 3, 2025
content.content:
Hello everyone,

It's sunday evening here in France and while I'm taking care of the kids I do a quick post to give some news and what's coming next / when / how...
For those who purchased a STL file
Most of the files will be sent "like that" as described in the Kickstarter (meaning no cut).
But the Hard-Top is only sent cutted down. For now the cutted plate is optimized for a BambuLab (25 cube) and I will create a pool tomorrow to know what are the other sizes asked.

Because some people asked 30x3, or 40x3 etc... and doing many cut is a very long process !
Once all payments are confirmed by Kickstarter I will proceed to the sending of the file, you will be able to get all the cut sizes.
Printed Kits (hard top or other files)
Once payments are confirmed I will proceed to the production and shipping! Tracking number will be provided.
The only part that require more work is the Fastback, which I am working on since the start of the campaign, and I will share the progress over time.
Next project the Cutting tool
I got some questions about the cutting tool as some of you would like to use it!
For now I can't tell when it will be ready, I have more things to fix and need to create the way to access it also.
But I will create a post here once I can share more about it :) stay tuned.

Thanks

comments.text: Could you make a 220 x 220 x 250mm for the majority of us who own ender 3s?
This is great news! Can't wait to start printing my hardtop. I am not sure where to vote but I would love a set optimized for 300x300mm in addition as it would save me some time.
